Added JobExecution enqueuing when the current JobExecution cannot be started because there is another JobExxecution with a matching target list. **Related Issue** None **Description of the solution adopted** Created a new service that stores which `JobExecution`s are enqueued and which currently running JobExecutionhas blocked the `QueuedJobExecution`. When the current JobExecution ends, checks for all `QueuedJobExecution` that have been blocked by the running execution and resumes all of them. **Screenshots** _None_ **Any side note on the changes made** _None_::

Signed-off-by: Aleksandra Jovanovic <aleksandra.jovanovic@comtrade.com> Brief description of the PR. Fix for permissions problems in Roles tabs **Related Issue** This PR fixes/closes part of issue #1801 **Description of the solution adopted** Updated delete method in `RolePermissionServiceImpl` class, to check for _ACCESS_INFO_DOMAIN delete_ instead of _ROLE_DOMAIN delete_ permission. Set permissions needed for enabling the Add button in Roles->Permissions to reflect those already set on the service side (access_info:read, access_info:write, domain:read i role:write). Updated permissions needed for enabling the Granted Users tab. **Screenshots** _None_ **Any side note on the changes made** This PR solves another part of issue 1801. The rest of the issue will be solved in the upcoming PRs. ::Why change this permission check? Since we this service manages the Permission assigned to the Role. So `role` was the correct permission to check. While `access_info` is the domain for the services/resources that are managing the assignment of the roles and permission to the user::@Coduz Before this change the user had to have `ROLE_DOMAIN` delete permission for deleting a permission (not a role, but permission) on Roles tab. It just didn't seem right. So, after serious thought I changed it to `ACCESS_INFO_DOMAIN` delete permission. Was I wrong?::Actually that was right, since those are the permission associated to the Role. The fact that those changes affetcs user's permission is a side effect. But the actual service to manage permission and roles associated to a user are the `AccessPermissionService` and the `AccessRoleService` that both require `access_info`. As I said before > [...] `access_info` is the domain for the services/resources that are managing the assignment of the roles and permission to the user. [...] Do you agree? ::@Coduz Then this check should be changed to the previous state? The `role:delete` instead of the `access_info:delete` ? Than the affected permission delete button's enabled state should be changed as well, to need the `role:delete` permission.  Should the button need only `role:delete`? Or `access_info:delete` as well? I wanted to confirm this with you, before making changes :)::The only permission required to delete a Permission from a Role is `role:delete`. So you can proceed to revert the change on the permission required in `RolePermissionServiceImpl` and change the permission checked when setting the enablement status of the Delete Button. You may also want to check that all permission on the Role view refers to the `RoleSessionPermission` except the enablement of the "Granted User" Tab, which requires `access_info:read`::

This solution proposes additional check in the `handleTokenLoginException()` and the block for handling the `IncorrectCredentialsException`. If the credential is locked `KapuaAuthenticationException` with `LOCKED_LOGIN_CREDENTIAL` will be thrown. **Screenshots** _None_ **Any side note on the changes made** _None_::`CredentialService.findByUserId()` will never return `null` as result . So this line can be removed.::Returning `null` here will produce a `NullPointerException` on the invocation on line 362.::Just `return` the result of the `if` ``` return credential != null && credential.getLockoutReset() != null && new Date().before(credential.getLockoutReset()) ```::The `null` value in question is assigned to the `credential` variable in case that the `credentialList` is empty. Than that credential is checked and boolean value returned. I can't see how that would produce a `NullPointerException`. Am I missing something?::Oh sorry, I missed the fact it was the return inside a lambda! So this is ok :) ::

Signed-off-by: ct-ajovanovic <aleksandra.jovanovic@comtrade.com> Brief description of the PR. Fix for date field value changes not enabling the Submit button **Related Issue** This PR fixes/closes #2298 **Description of the solution adopted** This PR solves problem regarding Submit button not being enabled if invalid Date value is entered in the KapuaDateField. The cause for this was that the previously created logic for enabling the Submit button depended only on the set value of the field - if the newly set value  of the field is different from its original value (isDirty).  With the DateField if the entered raw value is not a valid Date it will not be set, and this comparison would not work as the value for the field would stay null. This PR adds additional check for raw values being entered in the dateFields if the original value is null. Also new constructor and listener methods were added to the KapuaDateField. Affected Add/Edit dialogs were updated as well. **Screenshots** _None_ **Any side note on the changes made** _None_ ::

This PR refactors all the Eclipselink dependencies. Currently we're including the whole Eclipselink package, containing a lot of not needed classes; some of them are also conflicting with other dependencies, causing the Jetty based containers to print thousands of warnings. The aim of this PR is to only use the Eclipselink jars we actually need for each container. After this PR we still have some (~30) warnings from Jetty, but other dependencies are involved so we need to discuss about them. In order to make sure that everything is still ok we should test database interaction and XML/JSON serialization in all containers. **Related Issue** No related issue **Description of the solution adopted** No significant addition **Any side note on the changes made** No side changes::

This PR introduces the feature of running concurrent JobExecutions of the same job when they have a different set of sub-target. **Related Issue** _None_ **Description of the solution adopted** A list of target processed for each execution has been added. If a new JobExecution starts, the list of target to process will be compared to the list of targets of any running JobExecution of the same Job. If at least one element matches, the JobExecution will exit because there is conflict between the executions. This required changes also to the stop feature. Now you can - Ask the job to stop: this will cause stop to all running JobExecutions. - Ask to a specific JobExecution to stop: this will cause only the selected JobExecution to be stopped, while others will continue the processing. **Screenshots** _None_ **Any side note on the changes made** Some refactoring on Gwt models has been done to uniform object names ::

Signed-off-by: ct-ajovanovic <aleksandra.jovanovic@comtrade.com> Brief description of the PR. This PR adds a new button in the Jobs view in the console to restart the selected job for all the targets assigned to the job. Brief description of the PR. Updated CreatedBy/ModifiedBy grid properties **Related Issue** This PR fixes/closes #2207 **Description of the solution adopted** - Set _N/A_ as the value displayed on the grid when the true value is hidden from the logged in user. - Replaced the _Created By_ property in Users->Roles grid with _Granted By_ property and added the necessary implementation in the `GwtAccessRoleServiceImpl` class. - Added new `getUsersForAccount()` method to `GwtUserServiceImpl `class that returns results displayed on the Child Accounts -> Users grid. This method uses two accountIds:  `accountId` of the currently selected account for listing Users and another `currentSession.getSelectedAccountId()`  used for setting the _Created By_ property for each individual User. This method replaced the previously used `query` method of the same class that used only `accountId` for both queries and as a result hid some of the values from the currently logged user. **Screenshots** _None_ **Any side note on the changes made** _None_ ::Why not use the existing `createdBy` from `GwtUpdatableEntityModel`? There is any reason? The `createdBy` field in the `AccessRole` and `GwtAccessRole` represents who has created the "link" between a `User` and a `Role`, so it can be seen as "grantedBy" ::Uhmmm this column can be namend "CreatedBy" since also the MSGS refers to a `gridJobColumnHeaderCreatedBy` messages. I think that `username` column name is a mistake :) After rename, the `CreatedByNameCellRenderer` could be used. Please also remove `getUsername()` and `setUsername()` from GwtJob  and use `createtBy` instead.::RolePermission is not updatable. Please revert this. ::Uhmmm this column can be namend "CreatedBy" since also the MSGS refers to a `gridGroupColumnHeaderCreatedBy` messages. I think that `username` column name is a mistake :) After rename, the `CreatedByNameCellRenderer` could be used. Please also remove `getUsername()` and `setUsername()` from GwtGroup  and use `createtBy` instead.::@Coduz The reason for this change was that when using the new `CreatedByNameCellRenderer<GwtRolePermission>()` in the `RolePermissionGrid` I got this error: `Bound mismatch: The type GwtRolePermission is not a valid substitute for the bounded parameter <M extends GwtUpdatableEntityModel> of the type CreatedByNameCellRenderer<M>` Without that change in GwtRolePermission class, I guess we could create a `new GridCellRenderer` in the `RolePermissionGrid` like this: ``` columnConfig.setRenderer(new GridCellRenderer<GwtRolePermission>() { @Override public Object render(GwtRolePermission model, String property, ColumnData config, int rowIndex, int colIndex, ListStore<GwtRolePermission> store, Grid<GwtRolePermission> grid) { return model.getCreatedBy() != null ? model.getCreatedByName() : COMMONS_MSGS.notAvailable(); } }); ``` Would that be a better solution? Thanks, _Aleksandra_::Hi @ct-ajovanovic , I see. The problem is that `CreatedByNameCellRenderer` is defined as: ``` public class CreatedByNameCellRenderer<M extends GwtUpdatableEntityModel> implements GridCellRenderer<M> { ``` instead of ``` public class CreatedByNameCellRenderer<M extends GwtEntityModel> implements GridCellRenderer<M> { ``` `CreatedByNameCellRenderer` only needs the entity `GwtEntityModel` to access `getCreatedBy` and `getCreatedByName`. `ModifiedByNameCellRenderer` instead requires a `GwtUpdatableEntityModel` (which extends from `GwtEntityModel`)  `getModifiedBy` and `getModifiedByName`. Changing that should solve the problem :) Regards, _Alberto_::

## QA refactoring The first step in the refactoring of the QA infrastructure. The goal is to consolidate the CRUD and integration tests to use the same step definitions. In this step, the User service tests have been refactored. Work has started on the Tag service tests, but it is still ongoing. ### Test changes The various test packages were moved around to follow the new package layout. ### Special note Due to the ongoing nature of the refactoring, both the Rest and Tag service tests will fail. This PR improves the security of the Device Management Configuration tab on the Console Device view. **Related Issue** This PR fixes #2198 **Description of the solution adopted** Solution adopted replaces all password fields values with a placeholder, and then continues with the regular flow, sending the `GwtDeviceConfiguration` to the UI. On configuration change, the given updated configuration is checked for password fields. If a password field of the given `DeviceComponentConfiguration` is equal to the placeholder, the field is excluded to the configuration. If the value is not equal, the new value will be added to the cofiguration. By doing this we are relying on the configuration merge that the device performs on configuration put. The device merge the current configuration with new values provided. If the new configuration is missing some fields (all password fields if not changed) they will be merged with the existing value on the current configuration. The end result is that if the password is not changed, will be excluded from the configuration sent to the device and therefore the values for password fields will remain the current values written on the configuration. Instead, if the password is changed, will be included into the configuration and the new value will replace the old one **Screenshots** _None_ **Any side note on the changes made** Fixed also sending posting fields with empty value, which are now treated as `null` and therefore not sent as empty to the device. This is causing to not being able to set the device to use the default client ID (It's MAC address) ::

This PR changes the way `EndpointInfoServiceImpl` uses the fallback mechanism, reflecting on parent accounts only if the current one has no entries. **Related Issue** N/A **Description of the solution adopted** Before this one, when an Endpoint wasn't found in an account, the query was repeated for parent account, scaling up the hierarchy up to the root. This meant that a query could return no entries for a specific filter, even if there were endpoints available that didn't match the filter, and scale up the hierarchy. Now, before activating the fallback mechanism, an additional query is performed to be sure that the current account contains no endpoints at all. **Screenshots** N/A **Any side note on the changes made** N/A::

Brief description of the PR. Managing offline Device errors fix **Related Issue** This PR fixes/closes #2117 **Description of the solution adopted** Created new `DeviceMenagementException` which is used in `DeviceCallExecutor `class instead of the existing exception from `kapua-device-commons` package.  Handled this exception with the `KapuaExceptionHandler`. Added a  new Enum with needed error codes, as well as the necessary error messages. In `FileServlet ` class added a new catch block for handling `DeviceMenagementException ` thrown when executing Command on offline device. Also, replaced the `ServletException` which was shown to the user in the default catch block of the same method. **Screenshots** None **Any side note on the changes made** None Signed-off-by: ct-ajovanovic <aleksandra.jovanovic@comtrade.com>::Why are you creating a new exception here? `DeviceManagementException` didn't work for you?::@lorthirk It didn't look like a good idea to handle `DeviceManagementException`  with the `KapuaExceptionHandler`, as this is an exception from kapua-device-commons package, so I created that new exception. Should I change this? It seems like there is no unified way of handling errors in Kapua, some are shown directly to the user from service side and internal packages and for others the KapuaExceptionHandler is used. So, what approach should be used here?::Well... `DeviceManagementException` is a `KapuaException` anyway, so from a strict inheritance perspective your new exception doesn't add any different semantics. On the other hand, if we don't have a dependency from `kapua-device-commons` already, it may be a good idea to not create one. Pinging @Coduz for his feedback!::This has some reason to be? It seems a rather complicate way to print a stacktrace! ::@Coduz The problem was that this ServletException was actually showed to the user. So we had something like this: ![screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35954696/48002704-9de9c300-e10c-11e8-9279-8b371d02ff66.png) My idea was to replace that ServletException with a more generic KapuaException(KapuaErrorCodes.INTERNAL_ERROR) which had to be surrounded with a try/catch block. What do you think? Should I change this? ::By throwing it at line 233 and catching it in 234, and not re-throwing it in the `catch` block causes the exception to be eaten. If you wanted to log the exception only, and not returning it to the user, just use ``` new KapuaException(KapuaErrorCodes.INTERNAL_ERROR).printStackTrace(); ``` but the exception is already logged at line 231. If your intention was to throw a KapuaException, the code doesn't do that, and completes the execution of the method with no exception at all in case of an `Exception` thrown by the main method. ::I'm fine with a more specific exception for the `DeviceManagementException`s. I would just drop the `Kapua` and enforce that a specific set of error codes (as Enums)  is used. ``` public class DeviceMenagementException extends KapuaException{ [...] public DeviceMenagementException(DeviceMenagementErrorCodes code) { super(code); } ``` What you guys think?::

The current version of Jetty, 9.4.12.v20180830, is not compatible with OpenJDK 1.8.0_191, which is automatically installed in java-base docker container since it's the latest OpenJDK version published. The incompatibility lies specifically in the ALPN module, which is required from HTTP2 module. Since we're no actually make any specific use of such module, this PR disables it until a proper solution is found; an hint coming from the Jetty project maintainer suggests that we should move to OpenJDK 9+ where ALPN is bundled with the JDK (https://github.com/eclipse/jetty.project/issues/3028#issuecomment-432604515). **Related Issue** This PR fixes #2139 Also related to eclipse/jetty.project#3028 **Description of the solution adopted** The `http2` module has been removed from Jetty startup **Screenshots** N/A **Any side note on the changes made** This is only a short-term solution. When we will want to bring back HTTP2 in Jetty we may want to consider moving to OpenJDK 9+.::

All unit tests were grouped with annotation on test itself. When tests are run it is specified by this grouping which tests to run. One set of tests is unit and those are marked with org.eclipse.kapua.test.junit.JUnitTests **Description of the solution adopted** In case of cucumber integration tests, those are not marked and that means that when running those tests -Dgroups='!org.eclipse.kapua.test.junit.JUnitTests' is specified in command line. In addition to that --tags for cucumber are also specified to specify group of tests on cucumber level. This solves issue with unit tests running every time with each integration tests group. This will speed up tests at least 5 min times number of integration tests groups. It might also resolve timeouts on travis side. Embedded servers are started and stopped by step and not with before and after steps. This required some refactoring of many feature files (cucumber scenarios). Added start of event broker to broker scenarios. Added environment variable settings into feature files, because custom junit runner CucumberWithProperties didn't work. Also added was timeout at some of embedded servers. Embedded servers member variables were changed to static. **Related Issue** This PR helps resolving  #2088 **Screenshots** Not applicable. **Any side note on the changes made** This change required quite a lot of cucumber test refactoring. CucumberWithProperites runner was replaced by setting properties in scenarios. Embedded brokers and datastore are also started and stopped with steps and not with before / after annotations. This is basis for further stabilization of integration tests on travis and jenkins. Signed-off-by: Uros Mesaric Kunst <uros.mesaric-kunst@comtrade.com> ::

This pull request addresses the following points: - Application configuration file structure and naming - Handle configurations property groups - Containers names - Containers http ports ### **Description of the solution adopted** #### Application configuration file structure The file is now structured in a more modular way. Dashes have been removed from key names and camel case notation have been used. ``` { "kapua": { "vertxApp": { "startupTimeout": 120000, ... }, "restService" : { ... }, "datastoreProcessor": { ... "messageSource": { "amqp": { ... } }, "errorTarget": { "amqp": { ... } } } } } ``` This improves understanding of the application structure and coexistence of multiple  objects instances of the same type. #### Handle configurations property groups Configurations have been adapted to handle the case when the same configuration class type have to be used for distinct group of properties. For example the group of properties under the following paths: -  kapua.datastoreProcessor.messageSource.amqp -  kapua.datastoreProcessor.errorTarget.amqp This reduces the number of classes required to handle the configurations. #### Containers names - kapua-datastore-broker-processor - kapua-error-broker-processor - kapua-lifecycle-broker-processor #### Containers http ports Added configurations for accessing http service from outside the container. ::

Currently every Kapua application (Console, REST API) that wants to connect to the broker has to provide a username and a password via system properties (`transport.credential.username` and `transport.credential.password`). This means that every change to this user's password must be reflected in such properties. With this PR System Tokens are introduced, so that knowing and configuring the connecting user's password in advance is not needed anymore. Additionally, Shiro Realms have been refactored to better reflect classes hierarchy. **Related Issue** This PR fixes #2031 **Description of the solution adopted** `PooledMqttClientFactory` will automatically generate, when connecting a new client, a new credential of type `SYS_TOKEN` that will only last 15 seconds (configurable via the `system.token.ttl` system property) and will be disabled after one successful login. `KapuaSecurityBrokerFilter` will then be able to match the login attempt against this credential. Please be aware that the `transport.credential.password` system properties has been removed, and that `transport.credential.username` is now called `systoken.auth.username` and moved from `kapua-transport-mqtt` module to `kapua-security-shiro` module. **Screenshots** N/A **Any side note on the changes made** N/A::

This pull request addresses the following points: - Project layout for the external consumers feature - Kapua services lifecycle management - Load of configurations from an external file - Load of configurations with system and environment properties - Decoupling verticles and services ### **Description of the solution adopted** #### Project Layout The "apps" root project have been renamed to "processor". This project is a collection of processors each processor being a micro service running in its own Jvm. There are currently three processors defined: datastore, lifecycle and error. Each processor connects to the messaging layer and processes messages delivering them to the target Kapua service. #### Kapua services lifecycle management This change completes a part regarding the initialization of the Kapua service context that was missing in the previous implementation. #### Configurations. The microservice application can read system properties and environment variables The microservice can read configurations from an external file (i.e. a file non delivered with the resources of the artifact) #### Decoupling verticles and services Services (e.g. HttpService, the ) and service verticles (e.g. HttpServiceVerticle) have been separated; a verticle uses a service. This make code more reusable to cover multiple use cases. ### **Any side note on the changes made** Names for some of the apis, especially those connected to the Vertx EventBus have been changed to be more meaningful.::
